metadata.Title: CVE-2017-16995 on Ubuntu 16.04 ESM (xenial) - high
metadata.Description:
The check_alu_op function in kernel/bpf/verifier.c in the Linux kernelthrough 4.4 allows local users to cause a denial of service (memorycorruption) or possibly have unspecified other impact by leveragingincorrect sign extension.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2017-16995` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

linux-image-4.4.0-211-generic - 4.4.0-119.143
linux-image-unsigned-4.4.0-211-generic - 4.4.0-119.143
linux-image-unsigned-4.4.0-211-lowlatency - 4.4.0-119.143
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

linux-image-4.4.0-1086-raspi2 - 4.4.0-1086.94
No subscription required

linux-image-4.4.0-1088-snapdragon - 4.4.0-1088.93
No subscription required

linux-image-4.4.0-1129-aws - 4.4.0-1054.63
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

linux-image-4.15.0-143-generic - 4.13.0-26.29~16.04.2
linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-143-generic - 4.13.0-26.29~16.04.2
linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-143-lowlatency - 4.13.0-26.29~16.04.2
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-1114-azure - 4.13.0-1005.7
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-1099-gcp - 4.13.0-1006.9
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

linux-image-4.4.0-1094-kvm - 4.4.0-1020.25
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

linux-image-4.4.0-9026-euclid - 4.4.0-9026.28
linux-image-extra-4.4.0-9026-euclid - 4.4.0-9026.28
No subscription required

linux-image-4.13.0-1015-oem - 4.13.0-1015.16
No subscription required

criterions.comment: linux package in esm-infra/xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.4.0-119.143').
linux-mako: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support').
linux-flo: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support').
linux-raspi2 package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.4.0-1086.94').
linux-snapdragon package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.4.0-1088.93').
linux-aws package in esm-infra/xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.4.0-1054.63').
linux-hwe package in esm-infra/xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.13.0-26.29~16.04.2').
linux-azure package in esm-infra/xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.13.0-1005.7').
linux-gcp package in esm-infra/xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.13.0-1006.9').
linux-kvm package in esm-infra/xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.4.0-1020.25').
linux-euclid package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.4.0-9026.28').
linux-oem package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.13.0-1015.16').
